business.headline: Isha Ambani is Harper's Bazaar Icon of the Year, dedicates award to mother, daughterIsha Ambani dedicated the award to her mother, Nita Ambani, the Chairperson of Reliance Foundation. Isha said her mother is her role model who has "paved the way for me".

Centre recommends reducing GST on packaged water and bicycles below Rs 10,000The Group of Ministers (GoM) to decide on GST on health and life insurance premiums in its meeting on Saturday decided to exempt GST on premiums paid by individuals, other than senior citizens, for health insurance with coverage of up to Rs 5 lakh.

Who is Vasundhara Oswal, daughter of Indian billionaire, detained in Uganda?Vasundhara Oswal was reportedly seized by a group of 20 armed men at the family's extra neutral alcohol (ENA) plant. Local officials have connected her arrest to an ongoing investigation into the case of a missing person.

HDFC Bank Q2 results: Net profit rises 5% to Rs 16,820 croreHDFC Bank's net interest income (NII), a key measure of profitability, came in at Rs 30,114 crore, reflecting a 10% year-on-year increase, although slightly below the market expectation of Rs 30,306 crore.

Karnataka to impose cess on Zomato, Uber, payments to support gig workersKarnataka Labour Minister Santosh Lad said that the charge would be levied only on transport and not on the purchase of products.

Disney-Reliance venture to stream live sports exclusively on Hotstar: ReportWhile Reliance's JioCinema currently streams IPL cricket, Hotstar holds rights to other prestigious events like the International Cricket Council (ICC) tournaments, the English Premier League, and the Pro Kabaddi League.

Ashneer Grover withdraws mismanagement plea against BharatPe from NCLTThe plea alleged mismanagement and oppressive conduct by the fintech company's board. The withdrawal of the plea follows a settlement reached between Grover and BharatPe on September 30, 2024.

India to impose laptop import restrictions to boost local manufacturing: ReportThe planned restrictions, if enforced, could impact the country's IT hardware market, which is currently valued at between $8 billion and $10 billion.
Sensex, Nifty close in green as banking, metal stocks lift marketThe S&P BSE Sensex added 218.14 points to close at, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 104.20 points to end at 24,854.05.

DA hike by 3%: Check new salary, arrear calculations for employees, pensionersThe DA hike increase is effective from July 1, 2024, and was confirmed during a Cabinet meeting chaired by Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Wednesday.

India's growth rate shines bright in global economy, says Ajay Banga A lot of that growth is in India, is driven by the domestic market as well, which actually is a healthy sign, in some ways, said Ajay Banga, World Bank president.

IGL, MGL shares plunge up to 15% today. Here's why MGL's stock plummeted 11%, reaching a low of Rs 1,568.30, while IGL experienced a 10% drop, closing at Rs 453.70 on the Bombay Stock Exchange as of latest update.

Vistara to operate with 'AI 2' code after merger with Air IndiaVistara, a joint venture between the Tata Group and Singapore Airlines Limited (SIA), is set to formally merge with Air India on November 12, 2024.

Hyundai IPO: GMP signals discounted listing, but can it pull off a surprise?Hyundai IPO listing: Despite the buzz around the automaker's stock market debut, analysts and investors are divided on whether the stock will exceed expectations or struggle, given current market signals.
Explained: Why Infosys shares fell 5% after Q2 results Infosys share price: Infosys reported a profit after tax (PAT) of Rs 6,506 crore for the second quarter (Q2) ending in September 2024.

Wipro shares gain 4% post Q2 results, bonus issue news. Time to buy? The rally came after Wipro announced its second-quarter (Q2) results for the fiscal year 2025 (FY25), posting a 21.3% year-on-year (YoY) jump in net profit to Rs 3,209 crore.
Amazon AWS CEO warns staff: Return to office or resignAmazon AWS CEO Matt Garman defended the decision to implement a five-day in-office work week starting in January 2024.

Explained: Why European Central Bank cut interest rates againECB cuts interest rates: This marks the first time the ECB has implemented back-to-back rate cuts since it began its current cycle of easing in response to falling inflation rates.

RBI action against Navi Finserv, 3 other NBFCs: What it means for customersRBI's regulatory action comes in response to concerns over their loan pricing policies and other regulatory violations, sparking questions about the implications for customers.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: High-intensity blast outside CRPF school in Delhi, police probe onThe windows of several cars were shattered due to the explosion, sources said, adding that the loud noise could be due to a cylinder blast at one of the nearby shops.

Israel releases new footage of ex-Hamas chief Yahya Sinwar before Oct 7 attackVideo shows Sinwar walking in an underground tunnel with his wife and children, carrying supplies before the October 7 attack. The wife was seen holding a Birkin bag worth $32,000, according to the Israeli army.

Men now trying to be more like women: Kalli Purie at Bazaar Women of the Year AwardsKalli Purie, Vice-Chairperson and Executive Editor-in-Chief, India Today Group, gave the keynote address at Harper's Bazaar Women of the Year Awards 2024. Here's the full text.

Harper's Bazaar Women of the Year Awards 2024: A chain of empowermentEvery Harper's Bazaar Women of the Year awardee presented the award to the winner of the next category of high-achieving women, thus creating a chain of empowerment.

Bahraich remains tense, protesters set fire to bike showroomProtesters in violence-hit Bahraich set fire to a bike showroom, damaging bikes and cars, amid tensions in the district over the death of a 22-year-old man during Durga Puja celebrations on October 13.

Isha Ambani is Harper's Bazaar Icon of the Year, dedicates award to mother, daughterIsha Ambani dedicated the award to her mother, Nita Ambani, the Chairperson of Reliance Foundation. Isha said her mother is her role model who has "paved the way for me".

Diwali bash at New York's Times Square, Indian community, Mayor join festivitiesNew York Mayor Eric Adams and other top diplomats and officials joined the Indian community in a display of culture and unity at Times Square.

How F&O addiction is turning dreams into debt for retail investorsThe high-stakes world of Futures and Options trading is attracting millions of Indians. It is mostly younger investors who are betting big on F&O despite lacking awareness. Experts see gambling-like behaviour as people keep investing even while losing money. Is there a way of being successful in F&O trading?

IIT Delhi's Technology & AI Leadership Programme: Shaping the Future of Tech LeadershipAdvance your career with IIT Delhi's Technology & AI Leadership Programme. Designed for aspiring tech leaders, this programme offers cutting-edge insights, practical experience, and strategic acumen to navigate the digital era. Gain the skills to drive innovation, lead digital transformations, and position yourself as a visionary in technology leadership.

Rajasthan: The Royal Canvas for Dream WeddingsWhether it's the grandeur of a palace wedding in Udaipur, the mystique of a desert wedding in Jaisalmer, or the creativity of a themed wedding in Jaipur, Rajasthan offers a wedding experience that is truly out of the ordinary.

Jigra director Vasan Bala deletes Twitter account after film's box office failureDirector Vasan Bala seems to have deactivated his Twitter account after his film, Jigra, starring Alia Bhatt and Vedang Raina, failed to perform at the box office.

Paralympics star Avani Lekhara wins Harper's Bazaar Sportswoman of the Year Avani Lekhara won the inaugural Harper's Bazaar Women of the Year Award for sports on Saturday in Mumbai. She was honoured for her inspiring success at the Paralympics.

Israel intensifies strikes in Beirut, Gaza after Netanyahu assassination bidThe Hamas media reported that at least 73 people, including doctors, died after Israel launched airstrikes that hit several houses and a multi-storey residential building on Saturday.

RCP Singh announces decision to leave BJP, to form own partyRCP Singh joined the BJP in 2023 after leaving the JD(U). He left the Nitish Kumar-led party last year after the JD(U) sought an explanation on allegations of corruption levelled against him.

Djokovic pays tribute to Nadal after final encounter: You have an incredible legacy Six Kings Slam exhibition: Novak Djokovic honoured his long-time rival, Rafael Nadal. The emotional exchange marked the end of their legendary rivalry as Nadal prepares for retirement.

Ananya Panday wins Spotlight Actor at Bazaar Women of the Year Awards 2024Actor Ananya Panday talked about the opportunities that are available for women in the film industry today, as she won the Spotlight Actor of the Year award at the Harper's Bazaar Women of the Year Awards 2024.
Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!

Vikash Yadav, wanted by US over Pannun murder plot, arrested for extortionThe arrest came weeks after Vikash Yadav was mentioned by the US Department of Justice as a co-conspirator in the alleged Gurpatwant Pannun murder plot.

Do you train the same set of muscles every day? It can be disastrousTraining the same set of muscles can go horribly wrong and leave you with severe injuries. Fitness experts as well as doctors warn against it.

Aditya Roy Kapur on not being 'commitment-phobic': Had longest relationship in 20sActor Aditya Roy Kapur called himself a 'chiller' when Kareena Kapoor asked him about his relationship status on her show, What Women Want. The actor also shared relationship advice with everyone.

Kriti Sanon wins Best Actor at Bazaar Women of the Year Awards: Women can do it allActor Kriti Sanon was felicitated with the Best Actor honour at the Harper's Bazaar's Women of the Year Awards 2024, which happened in Mumbai on Saturday. The actor dedicated the award to her fellow women.

Virat's advice, strokeplay with Pant: Sarfaraz cherishes dream TestIndia vs New Zealand: Sarfaraz Khan cherished a dream day in Bengaluru on October 19. The batter scored his maiden century and enjoyed a terrific partnership with Rishabh Pant.

Ex-scientist, wife held hostage in home by 'courier boys', robbed of Rs 2 croreTwo men posing as courier boys held hostage an elderly couple - a retired scientist and his wife - at their home at gunpoint and decamped with cash and jewellery worth about Rs 2 crore in Delhi.

Jigra director Vasan Bala deletes Twitter account after film's box office failureDirector Vasan Bala seems to have deactivated his Twitter account after his film, Jigra, starring Alia Bhatt and Vedang Raina, failed to perform at the box office.

Sonam Kapoor doesn't fast on Karwa Chauth, shares mehendi pics: I like dressing upActor Sonam Kapoor posted lovely pictures of her mehendi design on Karwa Chauth, and shared that she doesn't fast on the festival.

Vettaiyan box office Day 10: Big growth for Rajinikanth's film on 2nd SaturdayRajinikanth's Vettaiyan, which dropped instantly in the first week, gained some momentum back at the box office during the second weekend. The film is now aiming at collecting Rs 150 crore nett in India.

Iyer has stressed that he is injury free and pushing his limits in terms of fitness. Shreyas made his comments after scoring a century against Maharashtra in the Ranji Trophy.

1st Test, Bengaluru Weather Live: Play starts with overcast conditionsIndia (IND) vs New Zealand (NZ) 1st Test, Bangalore Weather Live Updates: Play starts in Bengaluru after an hour's delay. New Zealand need 107 runs to win the first Test match against India. India have started well with Jasprit Bumrah picking up a wicket in the very first over.

South Africa, New Zealand set to enter new era of champions  Women's T20 World Cup: Sophie Devine's New Zealand and Laura Wolvaardt's South Africa will be looking for glory they face each other in the summit clash on Super Sunday at the Dubai International Stadium.

Watch: Ramandeep takes stunning one-handed catch in India A vs Pakistan ARamandeep Singh's spectacular diving catch dismissed Pakistan A's Yasir Khan and turned the tide in India A's Emerging Asia Cup clash. The catch, combined with stellar bowling, helped India A secure a dominant victory in their defense of 183 runs.

Djokovic beats Rafael Nadal in 'One Last Dance' at Six Kings SlamSix Kings Slam: Novak Djokovic defeated Rafael Nadal in straight sets in the third-place playoff-match on Saturday. Djokovic won the match 6-2, 7-6 (7-5). The duo faced each other on the tour 60 times since 2006 but won't be meeting anymore as Nadal will retire from professional tennis after the Davis Cup tie against Netherlands.

Manchester United beat Brentford 2-1 to claim first win in four matchesManchester United ended their winless Premier League run with a 2-1 comeback victory over Brentford. Goals from Alejandro Garnacho and Rasmus Højlund secured three crucial points, easing pressure on Erik ten Hag after a challenging start to the season.

Pant, Sarfaraz batted very well, but New Zealand made use of the second new ball: O'Rourke IND vs NZ, 1st Test: Fast bowler William O'Rourke admitted that Sarfaraz Khan and Rishabh Pant made life tough for the New Zealand bowlers, but also said that the Black Caps made a comeback by making good use of the second new ball. The Kiwis need 107 runs to win the Bengaluru Test and take a 1-0 lead in the series.

Mohunbagan continue Kolkata derby dominance with 2-0 win over East BengalMohun Bagan Super Giants continued their dominance in the Kolkata derby with a 2-0 win over East Bengal FC. Despite a balanced start, goals from Jamie McLaren and Dimitri Petratos sealed their eighth consecutive ISL victory over their rivals.

India A edge past Pakistan A in last-over thriller to make winning start Emerging Asia Cup: Tilak Varma's India beat Mohammad Haris' Pakistan by seven runs in a thriller in Al Amerat on Sunday. With the win, India moved to second in the table with a net run rate o +0.350.

Paralympics star Avani Lekhara wins Harper's Bazaar Sportswoman of the Year Avani Lekhara won the inaugural Harper's Bazaar Women of the Year Award for sports on Saturday in Mumbai. She was honoured for her inspiring success at the Paralympics.

Sarfaraz will give migraines to Australia bowlers: Sanjay ManjrekarSanjay Manjrekar lauded Sarfaraz Khan's stellar 150-run knock during India's first Test against New Zealand, emphasizing that the young batter's performance shows why he could be pivotal in India's upcoming tour of Australia, especially against their strong pace attack.

IND vs NZ, Sunday Weather Forecast: Will rain force a draw?IND vs NZ, 1st Test: Tom Latham's New Zealand need 107 runs to win the opening Test at the M Chinnaswamy Stadium in Bengaluru, but weather could end play a big factor on Day 5.

Ranji Trophy: Washington shines as Tamil Nadu pile mammoth 674 over DelhiWashington Sundar and Pradosh Ranjan Paul dominated Delhi's spin attack, piling on centuries as Tamil Nadu amassed 674/6, seizing control of their Ranji Trophy Group D clash. Delhi struggled both on-field and with injuries, setting up a tough contest ahead.

Thank God Pant survived run-out: Sarfaraz on his viral jumping momentSarfaraz Khan's animated reaction to save Rishabh Pant from a run-out during Day 4 of India's first Test against New Zealand went viral. Sarfaraz later revealed his concern about Pant's knee injury, adding depth to the heartwarming moment.

Not going to be easy win: William O'Rourke wary of 'world class' IndiaIND vs NZ: William O'Rourke said that New Zealand would not have it easy chasing the target of 105 on Day 5 of the opening Test against India at the M Chinnaswamy Stadium in Bengaluru.

Let's repeat Duleep Trophy: Sarfaraz reveals chat with Pant during Day 4Sarfaraz Khan revealed a vital conversation with Rishabh Pant that ignited their aggressive partnership on Day 4 of the Bengaluru Test. Recalling their Duleep Trophy experience, the duo's attacking approach led to India's commanding 462-run total against New Zealand.

New Zealand won't have it easy: Sarfaraz backs India to defend 107-run target Sarfaraz Khan suggested that New Zealand might find it challenging to chase the modest target of 107 runs on the final day at Chinnaswamy Stadium, especially if India can claim early wickets as the pitch begins to deteriorate.

German tennis star Eva Lys calls out troll for 'insulting' herGerman tennis star Eva Lys called out online trolls after facing abuse following her defeat in the Japan Women's Open 2024 quarterfinal on Friday. Eva lost to Japan's Aoi Ito in three sets in the quarters.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
